051901-d-05-19-01-SLRS.Narrative: TRAIN CREW ARRIVED AT HOME DEPOT/ INTERCHANGE TO START THEIR MORNING WORK AROUND 7:30 AM.  CONRAIL LEFT SIX EMPTY BOXCARS FROM THE OUTBOUND INTERCHANGE AND SHOVED IN 16 LOADED INBOUNDS FOR A TOTAL OF22 CARS.  CAR NUMBERS 1, 4, AND 6 FROM THE ENGINE HAD TO BE SET ASIDE DUE TO DOOR PROBLEMS.  CONRAILUNCOUPLED THE INBOUND TRAIN 1 TO 1/2 CAR FROM THE DERAIL.  CONDUCTORS WALKED TO THE REAR OF THE INBOUND TRAIN TO CLOSE THE ANGLECOCK THEN BACK TO THE HEAD END TO START SWITCHING OUT CARS 1, 4, AND 6.TRAIN PULLED AHEAD AND UNCOUPLED CARS 1 THRU 6 FROM THE 16 LOADS.  PLACED CAR 6 ON TRACK 3 , CAR 5BACK ONTO MAIN AGAINST 16 LOADS, CAR 4 OVER TO TRACK 3, AND CARS 2 AND 3 OVER ON THE MAIN AGAINST CAR 5 AND 16 LOADS.  CREW NEEDED APPROXIMATELY 1 AND 1/2 CARS LENGTHS TO CLEAR HOME DEPOT SWITCH TO SET CAR NUMBER 1 OVER ONTO TRACK 3 AND SHOVE BACK TO CLEAR ASSUMING THEY HAD SUFFICIENT ROOM BETWEENTHE END OF THE TRAIN AND THE DERAIL.  WHEN CAR NUMBER 1 CLEARED, THE 3 EMPTIES AND 16 LOADS WERE UNCOUPLED AND LEFT ON THE MAIN .  UNKNOWN TO THE CREW, THE REAR CAR, CN 604884 DERAILED ITS LEAD TRUCKAFTER RUNNING OVER THE DERAIL PROTECTING THE CONRAIL PENNS GROVE SECONDARY TRACK AND FELL OVER ONTOITS SIDE.  A SECOND CAR, CN 623303 WAS PULLED OVER ONTO ITS SIDE WHEN THE FIRST CAR ROLLED OVER.  WITNESSES FROM HOME DEPOT STATED THE REAR CAR HOPPED INTO THE AIR, THEN CAME TO A STOP LEANING TO ONESIDE,  AND FINALLY ROLLED OVER ON ITS SIDE PULLING A SECOND CAR DOWN WITH IT.
